item.title: Double yellow lines very worn, 4th February
item.description:
Double yellow lines in Sundridge Ave on culvert side of the road between roundabout at Elmstead Lane and width restrictions need repainting. They are very worn and partially obscured by leaves. Commuters regularly ignore these lines and rarely get tickets. This has been a problem for several monghs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 10B Kidderpore Avenue, Willoughby House, Garage Gate, 4th February
item.description:
Uneven and loose paving slabs are present outside 10B Kidderpore Avenue, NW3 7DA, Hampstead Manor, at the Willoughby House garage gate, creating a potential trip hazard for pedestrians. A resident has submitted a complaint stating that their child narrowly avoided tripping over the affected slab. Urgent remedial action is requested, due to the high volume of pedestrian traffic in this area, particularly children who attend the nearby school adjacent to the church.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25a-25b, Kidderpore Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The 3 tree drop there leaves, branches into my garden, it has ruined my garden, constantly picking up twigs, sweeping up leaves, the branches have damaged the roof of my garage in the past due to branches falling. We get no natural light at all., my garden is wasted area due to the trees.., 4th February
item.description:
The flats opposite must suffer from the leaves. And Don’t get much natural Sun light. Also the leaves fall and are so high against my fence it is rotting it.please can this get looked at. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Lane, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
